title: PROJECT-01 — Momentum vs Mean-Reversion
summary: Compare momentum vs mean-reversion signals with parameter sweeps, walk-forward, and realistic costs.
impact: Built for teaching under-resourced students; code is fully commented and reproducible.
overview: Two classic signals (trend-following vs mean-reversion) evaluated across look-backs and z-score thresholds with transaction costs.
objective: Identify robust signal families across parameters and assets.
methods: Signal design: k-period momentum; z-score mean-reversion

title: PROJECT-02 — Portfolio Optimization with Efficient Frontier & Risk Parity
summary: Build the efficient frontier and compare mean-variance, risk parity, and equal-weight allocations.
impact: Shows diversification’s effect on drawdowns and Sharpe.
overview: Mean–variance optimization vs risk-parity under long-only constraints; visualize the frontier and allocations.
metrics: Expected return, variance, Sharpe, diversification ratio.

title: PROJECT-03 — Pairs Trading Cointegration & Z-Score
summary: Stat-arb pairs trading using cointegration tests and z-score entry/exit rules.
impact: Demonstrates market-neutral strategies accessible to beginners.
overview: Find cointegrated pairs, fit the spread, and trade mean-reversion with band rules and risk controls.
objective: Evaluate profitability and stability of cointegration-based mean-reversion.
metrics: PnL, Sharpe, hit-rate, average spread half-life.

title: PROJECT-04 — Options Volatility
summary: Model and visualize implied volatility; compute Greeks and smiles/surfaces.
impact: Connects theory (IV, Greeks) to practical plots and scenarios.
overview: From Black–Scholes to IV smiles/surfaces; sensitivity analysis with Greeks.
objective: Build intuition for IV dynamics and risk exposures.

title: PROJECT-05 — ML for Markets
summary: Supervised learning for return/volatility prediction; careful CV and feature engineering.
overview: Classification/regression pipelines for market labels with rolling CV and proper baselines.
objective: Show when/why ML helps beyond simple rules.

title: PROJECT-06 — Sharpe Ratio Optimization
summary: Maximize Sharpe with long-only/box constraints; analyze sensitivity and robustness.
impact: Shows how constraints and estimation error affect allocations.
overview: Closed-form/SLSQP approaches to Sharpe-optimal portfolios with practical constraints.

title: PROJECT-07 — Monte Carlo Option Pricing
summary: Simulate option prices/Greeks with Monte Carlo; variance reduction and convergence checks.
impact: Bridges stochastic calculus and implementable code.
overview: GBM simulation for calls/puts; control variates/antithetic sampling.
objective: Quantify error vs paths/time steps; compare to BS.

title: PROJECT-08 — Value at Risk & Expected Shortfall
summary: Compute VaR/ES via parametric, historical, and Monte Carlo methods; stress testing.
impact: Explains tails and limitations of VaR; motivates ES.
overview: Loss distribution modeling and tail metrics under multiple assumptions.

title: PROJECT-09 — CAPM Factor Models
summary: Estimate CAPM betas and factor exposures with linear regression and diagnostics.
impact: Connects statistics to risk premia intuition.
overview: Run market model regressions, interpret alpha/beta, and test residual assumptions.
objective: Evaluate exposures and model fit quality.

title: PROJECT-10 — Daily Returns & Volatility
summary: Explore daily returns distributions, volatility clustering, and GARCH intro.
impact: Builds core intuition for risk and distributional shape.
overview: Descriptive stats, fat tails, and simple conditional volatility modeling.
objective: Visualize stylized facts and volatility dynamics.
